text: The Wright Consort was a single-decker body of a bus. It had a step-entrance. It was made from 1988 to 1999 by Wrightbus. The Consort body was built on the following chassis: * Leyland Swift chassis * Iveco Ford 79.14 chassis * Leyland DAF R-series chassis * Renault Dodge Commando chassis * Dennis Javelin chassis == Preservation == In 1990, A Leyland DAF Roadrunner with Wright Consort bodywork went into service as a disabled transport bus with Strathclyde Regional Council, In 1996, It transferred to East Renfrewshire District Council. In 2008, the bus was was donated to the Glasgow Vintage Vehicle Trust (GVVT), It is displayed at GVVT's Bridgeton Bus Garage site. ==References== Category:Step-entrance buses Consort
title: Wright Consort
